meanings.definition: To travel by standing on the side of the road and soliciting rides from passing vehicles.
meanings.sent1: I decided to hitchhike to the beach instead of taking the bus.
meanings.sent2: Many adventurous travelers choose to hitchhike when exploring new places.
meanings.sent3: The idea of hitchhiking to the moon made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams hitchhiked on the wings of imagination.
meanings.sent5: Hitchhiking through the forest, she felt the thrill of the unknown.

meanings.definition: A method of transportation in which one solicits rides from passing vehicles.
meanings.sent1: Hitchhike is a common way for backpackers to save money on transportation.
meanings.sent2: The old man preferred the freedom of hitchhike over scheduled buses.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog claimed he could speak the language of hitchhike.
meanings.sent4: In the city of dreams, hope was the hitchhike to success.
meanings.sent5: The concept of hitchhike opened up a world of possibilities for the young traveler.
